properties.name: Amerigo Vespucci Airport
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveVia del Termine 11, FirenzeFlorence airport, sometime simply called Peretola. Located 4 km from the center of Florence. A taxi can make the trip in 15 minutes (depending on traffic), and the Bus between the airport and Santa Maria Novella railway station takes 20 minutes.

properties.description: Posted by Artivisive  The grand Uffizi. Can be long lines in the summer but well worth the wait.

properties.name: Galleria dell'Accademia
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveVia Ricasoli 58-60, FirenzeThe David and lots of other great works.

properties.name: La Corte Arte Contemporanea
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive Via De\'Coverelli 27/R, FirenzeA small and intimate space showing a wide range of work and artists.

properties.name: Mcrae Books
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveVia Dei Neri, 30/R, FirenzeThis is a very nice place in the heart of the historical city with a warm and relaxing atmosphere and a vast choice of English, Italian and International books (mostly published in English.

properties.name: Mercato Centrale
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive Via dell\'Ariento, FirenzeThis market is located in a very characteristic district of Florence: San Lorenzo. The market is very cheap, and you can find here everything you need for your perfect Italian Style dinner: meat, fish, vegetables, fruits and the best tuscan and italian cheeses! Remember: the market is closed on Sunday! It definitely worths a visit!

properties.name: Mercato delle Pulci - Flea Market
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive Piazza dei Ciompi, FirenzeVery typical market located in the heart of the Sant\'Ambrogio district. Here you can find almost every kind of antiquities, second hand furnitures and clothes, coins, telephone card, old books, etc., etc... The market is open the last sunday (the fourth or the fifth) of the month! A part of the market (Mercatino delle Pulci) is permanent and is open every day (except on Sunday).

properties.name: Mercato di Sant'Ambrogio
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive Piazza Lorenzo Ghiberti, FirenzeThe market is either indoor or outdoor. Outside you can find fresh fruits and vegetables, clothes, flowers, shoes and houseware stands...Inside you can find meat, fish, pasta, general groceries, good cheeses, etc...Inside there is even a bar and a good (and cheap!) restaurant... A good place for shopping! Remember: it\'s open every weekday (except Sunday).

properties.name: Museo Dell'Opera Del Duomo
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive  Piazza Del Duomo, 49, FirenzeThis museum, located near the Duomo exhibits works that were once a part of The Duomo, The Battistero, and Campanille. One of the most important works is the unfinished "Pietà" by Michelangelo. Donatello\'s Saint John and Magdalene ,statue of Boniface VIII, the work of Arnolfo di Cambo, and the restored panels of the Door of Paradise may also be seen.

properties.name: Odeon Cinehall
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisivePiazza degli Strozzi, FirenzeOne of the best cinema\'s in town and definitely the best for watching original sound films. Located in one of the \'poshest\' square in town, the interior design and the architecture of this cinema are really particular and interesting. On Monday and Tuesday original sound films.

properties.name: Opera Di Santa Croce
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive  Via Dei Benci, 15, FirenzePart of Santa Croce\'s convent has been set up as a museum,enter through a door to the right of the church facade that opens up into a beautiful an open-air courtyard planted with cypress trees and the sound of birds singing.

properties.name: Ottica Foto Cine MB
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveVia Ghibellina, 131/R, FirenzeYou can get just about anything photographic here. Closed on Mondays.

properties.name: Paperback Exchange Di Panichi Maurizio
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveVia Delle Oche, 4/R, FirenzeNo matter the type of book - science, humanities, novels, paperback or hardbacks - any book available here can be ordered via email papex@papex.it. Second-hand books too.

properties.name: Poggiali e Forconi
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive  Via della Scala, 35/A, FirenzeGreat space showing established Italian artists.

properties.name: Poggiali e Forconi

properties.name: Rigacci Rolando E Mario Snc
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveVia Dei Servi, 71/R, firenzeSmall store with local artists and students from accademia. Friendly and helpful.

properties.name: Santa Croce
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisivePiazza di Santa Croce, 16, FirenzeSanta Croce, the church of the Franciscans in Florence, is one of the finest examples of Italian Gothic architecture. On many of the interior walls are masterpieces of Tuscan Gothic or proto-Renaissance painting: the Bardi and Peruzzi chapels\' frescoes are by Giotto; the Baroncelli Chapel has frescoes by Taddeo Gaddi and a polyptych by Agnolo Gaddi. There are sculptures by such masters of early Renaissance art as Rossellino, Donatello, Mino da Fiesole, Andrea della Robbia, and Benedetto da Maiano. Many famous Italians are buried in the church such as Leon Battista Alberti, Michelangelo, Vittorio Alfieri, Leonardo Bruni, Gioacchino Rossini, and Galileo.

properties.name: Secondo Piano
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive Borgo Santa Croce 8great walk up gallery with contemporary works

properties.name: Secondo Piano Art Gallery

properties.name: Sita Bus Line
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveViale Dei Cadorna, 105, FirenzeThe SITA bus station sits 100 meters from the Santa Maria Novella train station. You purchase your tickets inside. From here you have connections to most smaller cities that trains do not run to. One of the most popular destinations is Siena and San Gimignano.

properties.name: The Duomo
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveGrand church, always a good meeting place and point of reference if you get lost. Just look up and more often than not you will be able to see the cupola.

properties.name: Train Station, Santa Maria Novella
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisivePiazza della Stazione, FirenzeFlorence train station. From here you can go just about anywhere in Europe.

properties.name: Unicoop Firenze
properties.description: Posted by Artivisive Viale Giannotti Donato, FirenzeTake the 23 bus from the studio. Bigger than the store on Cimabue with the same great prices and quality.

properties.name: Unicoop Firenze

properties.name: Zecchi Colori
properties.description: Posted by ArtivisiveVia Dello Studio, 19/R, FirenzeYou can find just about any art supply you are looking for. They give student discounts, bring your id.
